result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christian Emmanuel Bratcher

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christian Emmanuel Bratcher in court.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status of Counsel held.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel on this case.  Court will schedule case for Order to Show Cause Hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Order to show cause hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christian Emmanuel Bratcher appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel on this case.  State advises Court that defendant has a pending case before Judge Havas, Br. 10.  Court will adjourn case to set at same time as defendant's other pending case.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. $500.00 Cash bail on deposit shall be returned to the person who posted it.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JLG.Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Christian Emmanuel Bratcher in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT MAY QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order  signed and filed.
